required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Of Tranexamic Acid For The Reduction Of Blood Loss In Patients Undergoing Surgery For Long Bone Fracture
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Randomized Phase IV Open Label Comparative Study Of Tranexamic Acid Plus Standard Of Care Versus Standard Of Care For The Reduction Of Blood Loss In Patients Undergoing Surgery For Long Bone Fracture

brief_summary.textblock: Tranexamic acid has been shown to reduce postoperative blood losses and transfusion requirements in a number of types of surgery. Most trials in orthopedic surgery have been conducted in arthroplasty, hip fracture and spine surgeries. This study would aim to see the effect of tranexamic acid in reduction of blood loss and transfusions for long bone fracture surgery, primarily fracture shaft of femur.

primary_outcome.description: Total blood loss was defined as the sum of intra-operative and post-operative blood loss. It was measured by weighing the drapes/ dressings or swabs prior to soaking to measure difference in weight and checking drain collectors until drains were removed.

secondary_outcome.description: Intra-operative blood loss was measured by weighing the drapes/ dressings or swabs prior to soaking to measure difference in weight and checking drain collectors until drains were removed.

Post-operative blood loss was defined as the sum of the drainage volumes measured over post-operative days 1, 2, and at drain removal. It was measured by weighing the drapes/ dressings or swabs prior to soaking to measure difference in weight and checking drain collectors until drains were removed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Blood Loss Assessed by Gross' Formula
secondary_outcome.description: Gross's formula for estimating total blood loss: Estimated blood volume*[(Hematocrit initial - Hematocrit final)/ Hematocrit average]; where estimated blood volume equals body weight in kilograms (kg) *70 mL/kg.
A uniform transfusion protocol was maintained for all participants in the study. Transfusion to be triggered at 8.0 milligram/deciliter (mg/dl) hemoglobin or haematocrit value of 24 percent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin Levels at End of Surgery, 1 hr Post-surgery, and Mornings of Day 1, Day 2, Day 4, Day 7 or Early Termination (ET) Post-surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline through end of surgery, 1 hr post-surgery, and mornings of Day 1, Day 2, Day 4, Day 7 or ET post-surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT) Post Surgery
secondary_outcome.description: DVT was defined if a segment of the deep vein of the lower limb was not compressible or a previous compressive vein became non compressive or there was no flow in the underlying vessel. Symptoms of DVT included pain in the lower limb, localized tenderness, swelling and warmth.

arm_group.description: Tranexamic Acid plus standard of care
Standard of care includes the routine surgical and anesthetic techniques being utilized to control blood loss.

intervention.intervention_name: Tranexamic Acid plus standard of care
intervention.description: Tranexamic acid given slowly intravenously (15 mg/kg body weight) 15 minutes before surgery followed by a second dose at three hour interval from first dose and third dose at three hour interval from the second + Standard of care (Standard of care includes the routine surgical and anesthetic techniques being utilized to control blood loss)
Standard of care includes the routine surgical and anesthetic techniques being utilized to control blood loss

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient undergoing surgery for fracture shaft of femur
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with a platelet count less than 100, 000/mm3 or history of thrombocytopenia
- Patients with known coagulopathy
- Patients with anemia (hemoglobin levels less than 8 mg/dl or hematocrit <24%)
- Patients with documented DVT or PE at screening or in past three months
- Patients having known hypersensitivity to tranexamic acid or any other constituent of the product
- Patients with any associated major illness (e.g., severe cardiac or respiratory disease)
- Anticoagulants (other than LMWH or heparin in prophylactic doses to prevent deep vein thrombosis), direct thrombin inhibitors or thrombolytic therapy administered or completed within last week

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Tranexamic Acid Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Tranexamic acid given slowly intravenously (IV) (15 milligram (mg) / kilogram (kg) body weight) 15 minutes before surgery followed by a second dose at 3 hour interval from first dose and third dose at 3 hour interval from the second + Standard of care (included the routine surgical and anesthetic techniques being utilized to control blood loss).

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Standard of care included the routine surgical and anesthetic techniques being utilized to control blood loss.

group.title: Standard of Care

group.title: Total

outcome.title: Total Blood Loss
outcome.description: Total blood loss was defined as the sum of intra-operative and post-operative blood loss. It was measured by weighing the drapes/ dressings or swabs prior to soaking to measure difference in weight and checking drain collectors until drains were removed.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) included all participants who were randomized to study treatment and received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Tranexamic Acid Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Tranexamic acid given slowly intravenously (IV) (15 milligram (mg) / kilogram (kg) body weight) 15 minutes before surgery followed by a second dose at 3 hour interval from first dose and third dose at 3 hour interval from the second + Standard of care (included the routine surgical and anesthetic techniques being utilized to control blood loss).

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Standard of care included the routine surgical and anesthetic techniques being utilized to control blood loss.

measure.title: Total Blood Loss
measure.description: Total blood loss was defined as the sum of intra-operative and post-operative blood loss. It was measured by weighing the drapes/ dressings or swabs prior to soaking to measure difference in weight and checking drain collectors until drains were removed.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS) included all participants who were randomized to study treatment and received at least one dose of study medication.

analysis.groups_desc: The mean difference with associated standard error (SE), and corresponding 95% confidence interval (CI) for the comparisons of tranexamic acid plus standard of care against Standard of care was presented along with the p-value for the test. Two-sample t-test was performed at 5% level of significance.

group.title: Tranexamic Acid Plus Standard of Care

measure.title: Post-operative Blood Loss
measure.description: Post-operative blood loss was defined as the sum of the drainage volumes measured over post-operative days 1, 2, and at drain removal. It was measured by weighing the drapes/ dressings or swabs prior to soaking to measure difference in weight and checking drain collectors until drains were removed.
measure.population: FAS included all participants who were randomized to study treatment and received at least one dose of study medication.

analysis.groups_desc: For 1 hour post-surgery, the mean difference with associated SE and corresponding 95% CI for the comparisons of tranexamic acid plus standard of care against Standard of care was presented along with the p-value for the test. Two-sample t-test was performed at 5% level of significance.

For 4 hour post-surgery, the mean difference with associated SE, and corresponding 95% CI for the comparisons of tranexamic acid plus standard of care against Standard of care was presented along with the p-value for the test. Two-sample t-test was performed at 5% level of significance.

For 8 hour post-surgery, the mean difference with associated SE, and corresponding 95% CI for the comparisons of tranexamic acid plus standard of care against Standard of care was presented along with the p-value for the test. Two-sample t-test was performed at 5% level of significance.

For 24 hour post-surgery, the mean difference with associated SE, and corresponding 95% CI for the comparisons of tranexamic acid plus standard of care against Standard of care was presented along with the p-value for the test. Two-sample t-test was performed at 5% level of significance.

outcome.population: FAS included all participants who were randomized to study treatment and received at least one dose of study medication.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Hemoglobin Levels at End of Surgery, 1 hr Post-surgery, and Mornings of Day 1, Day 2, Day 4, Day 7 or Early Termination (ET) Post-surgery
measure.population: FAS included all participants who were randomized to study treatment and received at least one dose of study medication.

class.title: Change at day 4 post-surgery or ET

analysis.groups_desc: For change at end of surgery, a Mixed Model Repeated Measures (MMRM) approach was used to relate the dependent (outcome) variable and independent (treatment, time point, and treatment-by-time point interaction as factors and baseline value as co-variate) variables taking into account the within-participant correlation arising from the repeated measurements.

For change at 1 hour post-surgery, a MMRM approach was used to relate the dependent (outcome) variable and independent (treatment, time point, and treatment-by-time point interaction as factors and baseline value as co-variate) variables taking into account the within-participant correlation arising from the repeated measurements.

For change at day 1 post-surgery, a MMRM approach was used to relate the dependent (outcome) variable and independent (treatment, time point, and treatment-by-time point interaction as factors and baseline value as co-variate) variables taking into account the within-participant correlation arising from the repeated measurements.

For change at day 2 post-surgery, a MMRM approach was used to relate the dependent (outcome) variable and independent (treatment, time point, and treatment-by-time point interaction as factors and baseline value as co-variate) variables taking into account the within-participant correlation arising from the repeated measurements.

For change at day 4/ET post-surgery, a MMRM approach was used to relate the dependent (outcome) variable and independent (treatment, time point, and treatment-by-time point interaction as factors and baseline value as co-variate) variables taking into account the within-participant correlation arising from the repeated measurements.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT) Post Surgery
outcome.description: DVT was defined if a segment of the deep vein of the lower limb was not compressible or a previous compressive vein became non compressive or there was no flow in the underlying vessel. Symptoms of DVT included pain in the lower limb, localized tenderness, swelling and warmth.
outcome.population: FAS included all participants who were randomized to study treatment and received at least one dose of study medication.

analysis.groups_desc: Fisher’s exact test at 5% level of significance was used as the event rate was low and the expected count for any cell in the (unstratified) 2*2 contingency table was less than 5.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Tranexamic Acid Plus Standard of Care
group.description: Tranexamic acid given slowly intravenously (IV) (15 milligram (mg) / kilogram (kg) body weight) 15 minutes before surgery followed by a second dose at 3 hour interval from first dose and third dose at 3 hour interval from the second + Standard of care (included the routine surgical and anesthetic techniques being utilized to control blood loss).

group.title: Standard of Care
group.description: Standard of care included the routine surgical and anesthetic techniques being utilized to control blood loss.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: The data for hemoglobin levels was planned but not evaluated on the morning of Day 7 post-surgery.
